ruling_link_text: Not exactly on the money
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders' outdated income inequality statistic

ruling_link_text: A classic Sanders factoid
statement_context: remarks at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia
ruling_headline: At DNC, Bernie Sanders repeats claim that top one-tenth of 1% owns as much wealth as bottom 90%
statement: "The top one-tenth of 1 percent now owns almost as much wealth as the bottom 90 percent."

ruling_link_text: Seems to give states the all clear
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention
ruling_headline: Sanders: Trump would allow states to lower the minimum wage
statement: Says Donald Trump "believes that states should actually have the right to lower the minimum wage below $7.25."

ruling_link_text: Claim doesn't add up
ruling_headline: No, Donald Trump, Bernie Sanders wouldn't have won even if super delegates were nixed
statement: "An analysis showed that Bernie Sanders would have won the Democratic nomination if it were not for the Super Delegates."

ruling_link_text: It could be hundreds of thousands
ruling_headline: Lack of a reliable tally from EPA, California hinder Bernie Sanders tap water claim
statement: "There are tens of thousands of homes right here in California where you turn on the faucet but you can't drink the water."

ruling_link_text: Clinton's position is no carbon copy of Sanders'
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says only he supports carbon tax and 'aggressive' approach to climate change
statement: "I believe we should have tax on carbon and deal aggressively with climate change. That is not (Hillary Clinton's) position."

ruling_link_text: Parsing the polls
statement_context: an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press'
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says he polls better against Donald Trump than Hillary Clinton does
statement: "Right now, in every major poll, national poll and statewide poll done in the last month, six weeks, we are defeating Trump, often by big numbers and always at a larger margin than Secretary Clinton is."

ruling_link_text: Parsing the polls
statement_context: an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press'
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says he polls better against Donald Trump than Hillary Clinton does
statement: "Right now, in every major poll, national poll and statewide poll done in the last month, six weeks, we are defeating Trump, often by big numbers and always at a larger margin than Secretary Clinton is."

ruling_link_text: We counted a lot more than one
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton wrong that no negative ads have hit Bernie Sanders
statement: "Let me say that I don't think (Bernie Sanders has) had a single negative ad ever run against him."

ruling_link_text: Exacerbating the debt, didn't cause it
statement_context: a town hall in San Juan
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders links Puerto Rico's debt crisis to Wall Street greed
statement: "Puerto Rico’s $70 billion debt is unsustainable and it is unpayable. And the reason why it is unsustainable has everything to do with the greed of Wall Street vulture funds."

ruling_link_text: Such a large wage hike hasn't been studied
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says minimum wage hike to $15 would reduce federal assistance by $7.6 billion a year
statement: "Increasing the min. wage to $15 an hour would reduce spending on food stamps, public housing and other programs by over $7.6 billion a year."

ruling_link_text: So you're saying there's a chance
statement_context: an interview on CBS News' "Face the Nation"
ruling_headline: Sanders: It's not impossible to get enough delegates to win
statement: Winning enough pledged delegates is "not impossible."

ruling_link_text: Income inequality and political inequality
statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders said poor people don't vote
statement: In the 2014 election, "80 percent of poor people did not vote."

ruling_link_text: He's correct, using narrowest definition
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton gets 0.2 percent of campaign donations from oil, gas employees, Robby Mook says
statement: "In last week’s debate, Bernie questioned Hillary’s commitment to fighting climate change because a whopping 0.2 percent of the money given to our campaign has come from employees of oil and gas companies. Not even 2 percent, mind you: 0.2 percent."

ruling_link_text: An imbalance, but not that big

statement: Says that in her speech to the pro-Israel group AIPAC, Hillary Clinton "had one line on the Palestinian people."

ruling_link_text: Not if they're still serving
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders ad ignores fact that members of Congress can't be paid for speeches
statement: "Washington politicians are paid over $200,000 an hour for speeches."

ruling_link_text: Updated: Tricky to track the dollars

ruling_headline: Sanders oversimplifies U.S. share of NATO
statement: "We spend about 75 percent of the entire cost of the military aspect of NATO."

ruling_link_text: Not as strong a connection as he suggests

statement: "We win when voter turnout is high, we lose when it is low."

ruling_link_text: A nuanced position
statement_context: a Democratic debate in New York
ruling_headline: Does Hillary Clinton want a $15 or $12 minimum wage?
statement: "When this campaign began, I said that we’ve got to end the starvation minimum wage of $7.25, raise it to $15. Secretary Clinton said let's raise it to $12."

ruling_link_text: Consistently moderate on guns

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Bernie Sanders 'has been largely a very reliable supporter of the NRA'
statement: Says Bernie Sanders "has been largely a very reliable supporter of the NRA."

ruling_link_text: As best as the imperfect disclosure rules show

statement: "I remain one of the poorer members of the United States Senate."

ruling_link_text: The support comes with conditions

statement: "The state that has the highest per capita number of … guns that end up committing crimes in New York come from Vermont."

statement: "The largest U.S. companies would owe $620 billion in U.S. taxes on the cash they store in tax havens."

ruling_link_text: Clinton supports trade deals but job loss question not settled

statement: Says Hillary Clinton voted "for virtually every trade agreement that has cost the workers of this country millions of jobs."

ruling_link_text: Clinton hasn't gone that far

ruling_link_text: Clinton, among others, has been much more transparent

statement: Says his campaign has released his past tax returns.

ruling_link_text: Only 2/3 of the story

statement: Says his free public university tuition program "is paid for … by a tax on Wall Street's speculation."

ruling_link_text: Bernie takes the crown

statement: "Bernie Sanders passed more roll call amendments in a Republican Congress than any other member."

ruling_link_text: He voted that way; significance is up for debate

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders supported Minutemen, indefinite detention for the undocumented
statement: In 2006, Bernie Sanders "voted in the House with hard-line Republicans for indefinite detention for undocumented immigrants, and then he sided with those Republicans to stand with vigilantes known as Minutemen who were taking up outposts along the border to hunt down immigrants."

ruling_link_text: Sanders wants more ambitious plan, but supports this one

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton wrongly says Bernie Sanders wants to delay the Clean Power Plan
statement: "The Clean Power Plan is something that Sen. Sanders has said he would delay implementing."

ruling_link_text: Data still has merit, but is growing old

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders' statistic on black, Hispanic unemployment has merit, but may be out of date
statement: "If you look at Latino kids between 17 and 20 who graduated high school, 36 percent of them are unemployed or underemployed. … African-American kids are unemployed or underemployed to the tune of 51 percent."

ruling_link_text: A garbled message
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders: U.S. 'only major country' that doesn't guarantee right to health care
statement: "We are the only major country on Earth that doesn't guarantee health care to all people as a right."

ruling_link_text: For 2012, and using one method
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says income inequality is widest since the 1920s
statement: "The gap between the very rich and everyone else in America is wider today than at any time since the 1920s."

ruling_link_text: Underlying data is 14 years old

ruling_link_text: The 1% is raking in the recovery

statement: "99 percent of all new income today (is) going to the top 1 percent."

ruling_link_text: He's right that voter turnout is weak
statement_context: a town hall in Austin, Texas
ruling_headline: Checking Bernie Sanders on Americans' low voter-turnout rates
statement: "In this last election in November, ... 63 percent of the American people chose not to vote, ... 80 percent of young people, (and) 75 percent of low-income workers chose not to vote."

ruling_link_text: It's not that specific
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders: GOP budget does not ask ultra-wealthy to contribute 'one penny' to deficit reduction
statement: "From 2013-2015, the richest 14 Americans increased their net wealth by more than $157 billion, yet the Republican budget would not require these Americans to contribute one penny to deficit reduction."

ruling_link_text: He gets the general trend right
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says U.S. was 1st in college degrees in 1990, but now ranks 12th in world
statement: "In 1990, the U.S. led the world in the percentage of 25-34 year olds with college degrees. Today we are in 12th place."

ruling_link_text: A whopper of a decline
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says tax share paid by corporations has fallen from 33% to 9% since 1952
statement: "In 1952, the corporate income tax accounted for 33 percent of all federal tax revenue. Today, despite record-breaking profits, corporate taxes bring in less than 9 percent."

ruling_link_text: Privatize, not abolish
ruling_headline: Sen. Bernie Sanders says Texas Republicans want to abolish Social Security, V.A. health care
statement: "(Texas Republicans) believe in abolishing Social Security, abolishing V.A. health care."

ruling_link_text: Includes firms that lost money
ruling_headline: Sanders: One out of four corporations pay no taxes
statement: "One out of four corporations doesn't pay a nickel in (federal income) taxes."

ruling_link_text: Public views on income inequality have been consistent for 30 years
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says six of 10 Americans say wealth should be distributed more equally
statement: "Nearly 6 out of 10 believe that money and wealth should be more evenly distributed among a larger percentage of the people in the U.S."

ruling_link_text: 2010 was highest rate in 17 years, but available data doesn't support sweeping claim

statement: "Poverty levels (are) at an all-time high."

ruling_link_text: Waltons are well-off

statement: "Today the Walton family of Walmart own more wealth than the bottom 40 percent of America."

ruling_link_text: Smaller than some foreign-based banks, but still a sizable share
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says six bank companies have assets equaling 60 percent of U.S. GDP
statement: "Today, you have six financial institutions, the largest six, that have assets that are the equivalent of 60 percent of the GDP of the United States of America."

ruling_link_text: 140 characters is too short to get in all the nuances
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says 12 million have slipped from middle class into poverty since 2000
statement: "Since 2000, nearly 12 million Americans have slipped out of the middle class and into poverty."

ruling_link_text: Americans work longer than most, but not all
ruling_headline: Sen. Bernie Sanders says Americans now work the longest hours of any people around the world
statement: "We now work the longest hours of any people around the world."

ruling_link_text: Very few would be subject to estate tax
ruling_headline: Sen. Bernie Sanders says 99.7% of American families would be exempt from estate tax
statement: Under the compromise tax agreement, "99.7% of American families will not pay 1 nickel in an estate tax."

ruling_link_text: Eye-popping stat that isn't accurate
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says ExxonMobil paid no taxes in 2009, but that's inaccurate
statement: "Last year, ExxonMobil made $19 billion in profit. Guess what. They paid zero in taxes. They got a $156 million refund from the IRS."

ruling_link_text: The studies agree, with only slight variations
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders, in viral speech, says top 1 percent earn more than 23 percent of U.S. income
statement: In 2007, "the top 1 percent of all income earners in the United States made 23.5 percent of all income," which is "more than the entire bottom 50 percent."

ruling_link_text: As long as Canada, Norway, Switzerland, Austria and others aren't "nations on Earth"
statement_context: an appearance on the Rachel Maddow Show
ruling_headline: Sanders says U.S. doubles every other country in per capita health spending
statement: "We spend twice as much per capita on health care as any other nation on Earth."
